introduction.p: In order to discuss systems of equations like this, it will be convenient for us to have notation for keeping track of multiple numbers at once. Vectors provide us with this notation. In the case of vectors with 2 or 3 entries, there is a strong connection between vector algebra and geometry. This can be very helpful to us as we develop an intuition for vector algebra, even when there are more than 3 entries.

note.p: Solve a system of linear equations algebraically in parametric form.

introduction.p: In , we will introduce systems of linear equations, the class of equations whose study forms the subject of linear algebra. In , will present a procedure, called row reduction, for finding all solutions of a system of linear equations. In , you will see how to express all solutions of a system of linear equations in a unique way using the parametric form of the general solution. Finally, in , we will learn how to write a system of linear equations succinctly as a matrix equation, which looks like Ax=b, where A is an m \times n matrix, b is a vector in \R^m and x is a variable vector in \R^n.
